intro: Capsella varia, commonly known as the variable catchfly, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has hairy stems and leaves. Its seed pods are distinctive, splitting open to release tiny seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Capsella varia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including gardens and fields.
